sentence.Network_en: In his diary of 1944 he proclaims unswerving loyalty to the monarchy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在1944年的日记里声称对君主忠贞不贰。

sentence.Network_en: Ever since I saw the diary excerpts I've been cast down.
sentence.Network_cn: 自从看到日记摘录，我就一直非常沮丧。

sentence.Network_en: As I scribbled in my diary the light went out.
sentence.Network_cn: 我正草草地写着日记，灯灭了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin diarium, from dies 'day'

entry.def: A diary is a book which has a separate space for each day of the year. You use a diary to write down things you plan to do, or to record what happens in your life day by day.

means.word_mean: 1. a daily written record of (usually personal) experiences and observations
2. a personal journal (as a physical object)

jushi.english: I have a very full diary today.

jushi.english: I keep a diary in English every day.
Did you write a diary while you were travelling in Europe?
jushi.chinese: 在欧洲旅行时你记日记吗?
